III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff 1 pushed Youth K and put him in a headlock. Youth K did
not report any injuries.
Investigation Interviews:
I notified Residential Director of the allegation.
I notified Complainant of the investigation assignment. She had
no additional licensing concerns.
I notified Youth K’s Foster Care Worker of the investigation
assignment. She had no additional licensing concerns.
I interviewed Youth K jointly with Government Worker at school
on 5/17/24. He said Staff 1 pushed him into his room and “put his
hands on me.” “I tried to get past him and said, ‘Don’t fucking
push me.’ He put me in a head lock, and I grabbed his legs. We
both fell.” On the floor, Youth K said Staff 1 pushed down on his
rib cage with both hands. “Staff 2 was there and did nothing…I
talked to police about the head lock.”
Youth K was observed with no marks or bruises on his neck. He
said his ribcage “still feels tight.” Government Worker contacted
Residential Director and asked her to have Youth K picked up
from school and seen by a doctor.
I interviewed Staff 2 jointly with Government Worker on 5/21/24.
He has worked at the facility for five years. Staff 2 said another
youth was acting out in his bedroom, so he and Staff 1 cleared the
youth hallway of other residents asking them to go to their rooms
for safety. “Youth K got an attitude but went to his room. Staff 2
stood outside Youth K’s door. Youth K approached Staff 2 and
2

grabbed his legs. Staff 2 tried to keep his balance and did not fall.
I was verbally de-escalating Youth K. Youth K asked to talk to a
supervisor.
Staff 2 said Staff 1 did not enter Youth K’s bedroom nor did he
push him, restrain him or place him in a headlock. To his
knowledge, Youth K was not injured in any way and made no
allegations of being mishandled at the time.
I interviewed Staff 1 jointly with Government Worker on 5/21/24.
He has worked at the facility for four years and has no disciplinary
write-ups in his personnel file. Government Worker read the
allegations aloud. Staff 1 said a “clear the area” was called due to
another youth’s behavior. “Youth K did not want to comply (stay in
his room for his safety). I stood near his bedroom door. He
grabbed my leg and wrist. I struggled for balance and braced
myself off the ground. Staff 2 came and verbally redirected Youth
K…Youth K did not fall or complain of pain.”
Staff 1 denied pushing Youth K or being inside of his room. He
denied placing him in a headlock or pushing down on his chest or
ribcage. Staff 1 denied touching him at all.
Video:
I viewed video of the long hallway on 5/15/24 from 7:26pm –
7:34pm. Youth K’s room is on an angle at the opposite end of the
hallway as the camera. Youth K and Staff 1 cannot be seen
together on video.
Documents reviewed:
Medical document from Henry Ford Emergency Medicine –
Fairlane dated 5/17/24 indicated Youth K was examined for chest
wall pain and prescribed Motrin for pain as needed.
An incident report by Staff 2 dated 5/15/24 indicates Youth K got
mad when he was asked to sit on his bed during a “clear the
area.” Youth K started “fussing” and tried to grab Staff 1’s leg.
Staff 2 stepped in and asked to talk to Youth K.
An incident report by Staff 1 dated 5/1/5/24 indicates Youth K got
upset when Staff 1 asked him to sit on his bed during a “clear the
area.” Staff 1 explained that he asked Youth K to do this for his
safety. Youth K grabbed Staff 1 by his leg and wrist making Staff
1 fall to the ground. Staff 2 asked if he could talk to Youth K to
calm him down. Staff 2 tried to calm him but Youth K continued to
be upset.
3

Government Worker had no findings.
Analysis Youth K had no marks or bruises after the alleged incident with
Staff 1. The incident was not captured on video and both staff
present denied that Staff 1 pushed the youth, placed him in a
headlock or pressed down on his chest or ribcage.
Two days after the alleged incident, Youth K told investigators he
was experiencing pain in his ribcage. He was seen at the
emergency room that same day and prescribed Motrin.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
